title: Macron shares his deepfakes for AI summit attention
description: The French president posted a montage of parodies featuring himself to promote an AI Summit in Paris.

title: Trump says US is 'committed to buying and owning Gaza'
description: There has been global condemnation of his plan to take over the strip and move its Palestinians out.

title: Taylor Swift, Lionel Messi, Jay-Z and Trump among big names at Super Bowl
description: Other stars spotted in New Orleans include Jay-Z, Blue Ivy, Nikki Glaser and Bradley Cooper.

title: Doge will look at military spending, says Trump as he defends Musk
description: The president dismissed conflict-of-interest concerns and promised more cuts 'maybe in 24 hours'.

title: Ecuador election ends in a 'tie' prompting run-off
description: Daniel Noboa and his main challenger Luisa González received near identical percentages of the vote.

title: Trial to begin of man accused of stabbing Salman Rushdie
description: A 27-year-old man faces a jury trial in New York state, where Mr Rushdie is expected to testify.

title: Ed Sheeran stopped from busking in Bengaluru by Indian police
description: Sheeran says it was a planned performance, but police say they refused permission to prevent congestion.

title: Minister blames monkey for Sri Lanka nationwide power cut
description: The outage is yet to be fully fixed, meaning hospitals and other buildings are having to use generators.

title: 'I miss my school': BBC launches programme for children in war zones
description: The BBC World Service has launched an Arabic edition of its award-winning educational programme Dars.

title: Kosovo PM's party leading but short of majority - partial results
description: Albin Kurti's party is on track to come first in Kosovo's general election but may not be able to govern alone.

title: 'Grease and rags' sewer fatberg halts Bryan Adams concert
description: The performance in Perth, Australia was postponed due to the blockage of a major sewer.

title: Baltic states unplug from Russia and join EU power grid
description: "Today, history is made," EU chief Ursula von der Leyen told a ceremony in Lithuania's capital.

title: Bodies of migrants found in Libya mass grave, authorities say
description: It comes just days after another mass grave with 19 bodies was found on a farm nearby.

title: Germany's front-runner Merz: Risk-taker who flirted with far right
description: A look at the conservative leader who broke a German taboo by accepting support from the AfD.

title: Why more young men in Germany are turning to the far right
description: The far right here and elsewhere in Europe attracts an increasing number of young people, particularly men.

title: Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl show was one big tease
description: The star hinted that he might not play his smash hit Not Like Us, but gave viewers plenty to absorb.

title: How Spain's economy became the envy of Europe
description: The growth is led by a tourism boom, with Spain nearing France as the world's most visited country.

title: The DR Congo rebel leader whose fighters have created turmoil
description: M23 chief Sultani Makenga, wanted for war crimes, has fought as a rebel and a soldier in two countries.

title: Trump wants to end birthright citizenship. Where do other countries stand?
description: The US has historically given automatic citizenship to anyone born in the country, but this principle is not the norm globally.

title: 'Trump study sessions': How Japan PM's homework paid off
description: The Japanese prime minister gets much needed reassurances that his country is still America's top ally.

title: Rapper feud, Trump's history and Becks: Things to watch out for at Super Bowl 59
description: Will Kendrick Lamar use his half-time show to beef with Drake and will Taylor Swift also get a ring?

title: Frozen in time: Rare early images of the Himalayas from Italian pioneer
description: Vittorio Sella's work shaped both mountain photography and mountaineering history.

title: 17 things Trump and his team did this week
description: In his third week back in office, Trump took action on issues from transgender competitors in women's sports to Gaza.

title: Tourists leave after earthquakes rock Santorini, but resilient locals remain
description: Many started evacuating the island as it was hit by tremors - but some have decided to stay.

title: The indigenous community fleeing its drowning island
description: Rising sea levels threaten homes in Panama, but not everyone wants to leave.

title: Who's pulling the strings in the DR Congo crisis?
description: As M23 rebels advance in DR Congo, regional players meet to defuse the escalating crisis.

title: Lasers, ladders and a leap: Photos of the week
description: A selection of news photographs from around the world.

title: Sweden's worst mass shooting leaves immigrant community on edge
description: Among the dead in Sweden's first school shooting were Syrians and Bosnians.

title: Casinos, high-rises and fraud: The BBC visits a bizarre city built on scams
description: A haven for the super rich, or a city built on scams? The BBC was invited to find out.

title: Stylish earrings to gold shoes on show at South Africa's biggest political event
description: A collection of some of the best outfits from the State of the Nation Address.

title: How long could the Santorini 'seismic crisis' last?
description: Scientists say it is unclear how many more earthquakes will come to the idyllic Greek island.

title: Why Trump is on the warpath in Somalia
description: Militants in the mountains of north-eastern Somalia have become the beating heart of Islamic State in Africa.

title: Oscar-nominated West Bank feature director says films 'can be part of change'
description: The film by a Israeli-Palestinian group follows the fight over home demolitions by the Israeli army.

title: Thousands of baby turtles released in Brazil
description: The project aims to boost numbers of threatened tracajás turtles in Amazonas state.

title: Watch: Passenger train engulfed by flames in Pennsylvania

title: Released Palestinian prisoners greeted in Ramallah
description: Some 180 prisoners are being freed in exchange for three Israeli hostages.

title: Watch: How triple Israeli hostage release unfolded
description: Or Levy, Ohad Ben Ami and Eli Sharabi are returning home after being released in Gaza on Saturday.

title: Watch police on horses chase after suspected drug dealer
description: Mounted police galloped after a man who fled on foot when officers approached him in Jacksonville, Florida.
